00003 package Value::Set;
00004 my $pkg = 'Value::Set';
00005 
00006 use strict; no strict "refs";
00007 our @ISA = qw(Value);
00008 
00009 #  Convert a value to a Set.  The value can be
00010 #    a list of numbers, or an reference to an array of numbers
00011 #    a point, vector or set object
00012 #    a matrix if it is  n x 1  or  1 x n
00013 #    a string that evaluates to a point
00014 #
00015 sub new {
00016   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00017   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00018   my $p = shift; $p = [$p,@_] if scalar(@_) > 0;
00019   $p = Value::makeValue($p,context=>$context) if defined($p) && !ref($p);
00020   return $p if Value::isFormula($p) && Value::classMatch($self,$p->type);
00021   my $isFormula = 0; my @d; @d = $p->dimensions if Value::classMatch($p,'Matrix');
00022   if (Value::classMatch($p,'List') && $p->typeRef->{entryType}{name} eq 'Number') {$p = $p->data}
00023   elsif (Value::classMatch($p,'Point','Vector','Set')) {$p = $p->data}
00024   elsif (scalar(@d) == 1) {$p = [$p->value]}
00025   elsif (scalar(@d) == 2 && $d[0] == 1) {$p = ($p->value)[0]}
00026   elsif (scalar(@d) == 2 && $d[1] == 1) {$p = ($p->transpose->value)[0]}
00027   else {
00028     $p = [$p] if defined($p) && ref($p) ne 'ARRAY';
00029     foreach my $x (@{$p}) {
00030       $x = Value::makeValue($x,context=>$context);
00031       $isFormula = 1 if Value::isFormula($x);
00032       Value::Error("An element of a set can't be %s",Value::showClass($x))
00033         unless Value::isRealNumber($x);
00034     }
00035   }
00036   return $self->formula($p) if $isFormula;
00037   my $def = $context->lists->get('Set');
00038   my $set = bless {
00039     data => $p, open => $def->{open}, close => $def->{close},
00040     context => $context,
00041   }, $class;
00042   $set = $set->reduce if $self->getFlag('reduceSets');
00043   return $set;
00044 }

00046 #
00047 #  Set the canBeInterval flag
00048 #
00049 sub make {
00050   my $self = shift;
00051   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00052   my $def = $context->lists->get('Set');
00053   $self = $self->SUPER::make($context,@_);
00054   $self->{open} = $def->{open}; $self->{close} = $def->{close};
00055   return $self;
00056 }

00058 sub isOne {0}
00059 sub isZero {0}
00060 
00061 sub canBeInUnion {1}
00062 sub isSetOfReals {1}
00063 
00064 #
00065 #  Try to promote arbitrary data to a set
00066 #
00067 sub promote {
00068   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00069   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00070   my $x = (scalar(@_) ? shift : $self);
00071   $x = Value::makeValue($x,context=>$context);
00072   return $self->new($context,$x,@_) if scalar(@_) > 0 || Value::isRealNumber($x);
00073   return $x->inContext($context) if ref($x) eq $class;
00074   $x = $context->Package("Interval")->promote($context,$x) if $x->canBeInUnion;
00075   return $x->inContext($context) if $x->isSetOfReals;
00076   return $self->new($context,$x->value)
00077     if $x->type eq 'List' && $x->typeRef->{entryType}{name} eq 'Number';
00078   Value::Error("Can't convert %s to %s",Value::showClass($x),Value::showClass($self));
00079 }

00086 #
00087 #  Addition forms unions (or combines sets)
00088 #
00089 sub add {
00090   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00091   return $self->make($l->value,$r->value) if $l->type eq 'Set' && $r->type eq 'Set';
00092   Value::Union::form($self->context,$l,$r);
00093 }
00094 sub dot {my $self = shift; $self->add(@_)}
00095 
00096 #
00097 #  Subtraction removes items from a set
00098 #
00099 sub sub {
00100   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00101   return Value::Union::form($self->context,Value::Union::subUnionUnion([$l],[$r]));
00102 }

00104 #
00105 #  Subtract one set from another
00106 #    (return the resulting set or nothing for empty set)
00107 #
00108 sub subSetSet {
00109   my ($self,$other) = @_;
00110   my @l = $self->sort->value; my @r = $other->sort->value;
00111   my @entries = ();
00112   while (scalar(@l) && scalar(@r)) {
00113     if ($l[0] < $r[0]) {
00114       push(@entries,shift(@l));
00115     } else {
00116       while ($l[0] == $r[0]) {shift(@l); last if scalar(@l) == 0};
00117       shift(@r);
00118     }
00119   }
00120   push(@entries,@l);
00121   return () unless scalar(@entries);
00122   return $self->make(@entries);
00123 }
00124 
00125 #
00126 #  Subtract a set from an interval
00127 #    (returns a collection of intervals)
00128 #
00129 sub subIntervalSet {
00130   my $self = shift;
00131   my $I = $self->copy; my $S = shift;
00132   my @union = (); my ($a,$b) = $I->value;
00133   foreach my $x ($S->reduce->value) {
00134     next if $x < $a;
00135     if ($x == $a) {
00136       return @union if $a == $b;
00137       $I->{open} = '(';
00138     } elsif ($x < $b) {
00139       my $context = $self->context;
00140       push(@union,$context->Package("Interval")->make($context,$I->{open},$a,$x,')'));
00141       $I->{open} = '('; $I->{data}[0] = $a = $x;
00142     } else {
00143       $I->{close} = ')' if ($x == $b);
00144       last;
00145     }
00146   }
00147   return (@union,$I);
00148 }
00149 
00150 #
00151 #  Subtract an interval from a set
00152 #    (returns the resulting set or nothing for the empty set)
00153 #
00154 sub subSetInterval {
00155   my $S = shift; my $I = shift;
00156   my ($a,$b) = $I->value;
00157   my @entries = ();
00158   foreach my $x ($S->value) {
00159     push(@entries,$x)
00160       if ($x < $a || $x > $b) ||
00161          ($x == $a && $I->{open}  ne '[') ||
00162      ($x == $b && $I->{close} ne ']');
00163   }
00164   return () unless scalar(@entries);
00165   return $S->make(@entries);
00166 }
00167 
00168 #
00169 #  Compare two sets lexicographically on their sorted contents
00170 #
00171 sub compare {
00172   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_; my $self = $l;
00173   $r = $self->promote($r);
00174   if ($r->classMatch('Interval')) {
00175     return ($flag? 1: -1) if $l->length == 0;
00176     my ($a,$b) = $r->value; my $c = $l->{data}[0];
00177     return (($flag) ? $a <=> $c : $c <=> $a)
00178       if ($l->length == 1 && $a == $b) || $a != $c;
00179     return ($flag? 1: -1);
00180   }
00181   if ($l->getFlag('reduceSetsForComparison')) {$l = $l->reduce; $r = $r->reduce}
00182   if ($flag) {my $tmp = $l; $l = $r; $r = $tmp};
00183   my @l = $l->sort->value; my @r = $r->sort->value;
00184   while (scalar(@l) && scalar(@r)) {
00185     my $cmp = shift(@l) <=> shift(@r);
00186     return $cmp if $cmp;
00187   }
00188   return scalar(@l) - scalar(@r);
00189 }

00196 #
00197 #  Remove repeated values
00198 #
00199 sub reduce {
00200   my $self = shift;
00201   return $self if $self->{isReduced} || $self->length < 2;
00202   my @data = $self->sort->value; my @set = ();
00203   while (scalar(@data)) {
00204     push(@set,shift(@data));
00205     shift(@data) while (scalar(@data) && $set[-1] == $data[0]);
00206   }
00207   return $self->make(@set)->with(isReduced=>1);
00208 }
00209 
00210 #
00211 #  True if a union is reduced.
00212 #
00213 #  (In scalar context, is a pair whose first entry is true or
00214 #   false, and when true the second value is the reason the
00215 #   set is not reduced.)
00216 #
00217 sub isReduced {
00218   my $self = shift;
00219   return 1 if $self->{isReduced} || $self->length < 2;
00220   my $isReduced = $self->reduce->length == $self->length;
00221   return $isReduced if $isReduced || !wantarray;
00222   return (0,"repeated elements");
00223 }

00225 #
00226 #  Sort the data for a set
00227 #
00228 sub sort {
00229   my $self = shift;
00230   return $self->make(CORE::sort {$a <=> $b} $self->value);
00231 }

00234 #
00235 #  Tests for containment, subsets, etc.
00236 #
00237 
00238 sub contains {
00239   my $self = shift; my $other = $self->promote(@_)->reduce;
00240   return unless $other->type eq 'Set';
00241   return ($other-$self)->isEmpty;
00242 }
00243 
00244 sub isSubsetOf {
00245   my $self = shift; my $other = $self->promote(@_);
00246   return $other->contains($self);
00247 }
00248 
00249 sub isEmpty {(shift)->length == 0}
00250 
00251 sub intersect {
00252   my $self = shift; my $other = $self->promote(@_);
00253   return $self-($self-$other);
00254 }
00255 
00256 sub intersects {
00257   my $self = shift; my $other = $self->promote(@_);
00258   return !$self->intersect($other)->isEmpty;
00259 }
